abstract.text: Add the ability for players to exchange game data and send messages while waiting for their turns.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

metadata.title: Exchanging data between players in turn-based games

inlineContent.text: You can increase engagement in turn-based games by letting participants communicate and exchange data while they wait for the current participant to take their turn.

To implement this feature, provide an interface in your game where participants can communicate — for example, exchange items in the game. Then initiate an exchange request from the user of your game instance, called the
local player

, to one or more recipients. GameKit handles the requests between participants and the status of the exchange object as participants reply. You implement protocol methods to accept exchanges, display results, and save completed exchanges. When you save completed exchanges, GameKit notifies all other participants.
To receive the protocol messages, register as a listener of the local player, and conform to the
protocol. For more information, see
The code examples in this article use GameKit asynchronous methods that you invoke from an
method or within a
structure. For details about asynchronous flows, see

Any participant, including the current participant who is taking their turn, can send an exchange request to one or more other participants. When sending an exchange request, you pass the recipients, the game-specific exchange data, and a localized message to the
method.

code: try await match.sendExchange(to: participants, data: data!, localizableMessageKey:
"This is my exchange request.", arguments: [], timeout: GKTurnTimeoutDefault)

inlineContent.text: In the exchange data, provide enough game-specific information for recipients to decide whether to accept or decline the request.
To localize the message, add the key you pass and a placeholder translation to a
file in your project (for example, the default
file). For more information about adapting your game for different languages and regions, see
When a recipient receives an exchange request, GameKit invokes the

protocol method, passing the exchange object. If your game isn’t running or is in the background, GameKit displays a notification containing the localized message first. When the recipient taps the notification, GameKit launches your game or brings your game back to the foreground, and then invokes the method.
To accept or decline the exchange request on behalf of the participant, implement the
method using the following steps:
Unarchive the exchange data in the
object that GameKit passes to this method.
If the status property is
, present an interface containing the exchange data that lets the recipient accept or decline the request.
To display more details to the recipient, use the other
properties, such as the
and
properties.
If the recipient accepts the exchange request, invoke the
method. Optionally, pass additional exchange information back to the sender using the
parameter.
When all recipients reply to an exchange request or requests time out, GameKit invokes the
method in the current participant’s game instance and the original sender’s game instance.
GameKit passes the exchange object with the status property of
and the recipient details (
objects) in the
parameter. Optionally, present the replies along with their messages and exchange data to the original sender.
If the local player is the current participant, implement the
method to resolve and save the exchange data. Also, save completed exchanges before the current participant ends their turn, forfeits the match, or ends the match.

Add your game-specific exchange data to the match data that you save in Game Center and send to participants. For example, add code that transfers items between participants or saves their conversations.
Invoke the
method, passing the current match data, including any exchange data, and the completed exchange objects. This method removes the exchanges from the match’s
and
properties.
Only the current participant can invoke the
method, even if the current participant isn’t involved in the exchanges.
When the current participant saves completed exchanges with match data, GameKit invokes the

method in each participant game instance. Implement this method to present the new match data, including the exchange data. For example, show the items that transfer between participants and recipient reply messages.
You can cancel an exchange request anytime before the current participant saves it and the status property becomes
. To cancel an exchange request, use the
method. Pass a localizable message that GameKit displays in a notification if the recipient isn’t running your game or it’s in the background.

code: try await exchange.cancel(withLocalizableMessageKey: "I'm canceling the exchange request.", arguments: [])

inlineContent.text: To update the gameplay interface and display the message when a participant cancels an exchange request, implement the
protocol method.

abstract.text: A Boolean value indicating whether GameKit can add badges to a turn-based game icon.
Expand the market for your app by supporting multiple languages and regions.
Enable players to interact with friends, compare leaderboard ranks, earn achievements, and participate in multiplayer games.
The protocol that handles turn-based and data-exchange events between participants in a match.
Handles when the sender cancels an exchange request they intiated.
Handles when all recipients of an exchange request respond.
Handles when the local player receives an exchange request from another participant.
Handles turn-based match events, such as accepting invitations, passing turns, and saving match data.
Exchange request information that participants send in a turn-based match.
Cancels an exchange request.
A localized message from the sender to the recipients of an exchange request.
Replies to an exchange request on behalf of a recipient.
The participant who sends the exchange request to recipients.
Details about a recipient’s response to an exchange request.
GameKit sent the exchange request to recipients but not all recipients replied.
All recipients of the exchange request replied.
The current participant saved the exchange request.
An object that encapsulates the match data for games where players take turns.
The exchange requests that all recipients replied to and the current participant needs to save.
The exchange requests that are active or complete.
Saves match data for completed exchanges without ending the turn.
Sends an exchange request that contains your game data to one or more participants.
An interface that allows a player to invite other players to a turn-based match and automatch to fill any empty slots.
A participant in a turn-based match.
Develop games where multiple players take turns and can exchange data while waiting for their turn.
Notify players of match events by sending messages and game data.

doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/Ga.title: Sending messages to players in turn-based games

abstract.text: Let Game Center store and forward match data between players in a turn-based game.

doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/Ga.title: Starting turn-based matches and passing turns between players
